text: Hi, this is Emily from MinuteEarth.

I’m here in real human form today to share
a new project we’ve been working on with
MinutePhysics and Veritasium.

Several months ago, the online streaming service
VRV approached us and asked us if we had an
idea for a new, original show.

VRV already hosts lots of animated shows,
but the idea here was for us to create a partly

animated science show with longer episodes
that would live exclusively on VRV.
And that’s what we did!
Check it out:.

So the show is called Paradigms, and each
episode takes one big idea or question and

traces how we got to understanding things
the way we do today.

In episode one, we tackle the science of seeing,
and how humans went from the Ancient Greek

idea that our eyes shoot out a visual fire
in order to see, to our modern understanding
of how the eye and the brain make vision possible.

You can watch the full first episode right
now on VRV by clicking the link in the description.

There is one hitch though – so far, Paradigms
is only available in the U.S., but international

viewers, we’re working on making it accessible
to you too.

But if you’re in the U.S., please do go
check out Paradigms; the more people watch

it, the more likely we’ll be able to make
the rest of the season, so if you like episode
one, share it with your friends!

You can also help boost our chances of getting
to make more episodes by creating a free VRV
account and commenting on our video.

So go check out Paradigms – it could change
the way you see the way you see things.
